member.name: T:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.FieldTestProcessor
member.summary: This is a test processor similar to the FileSystemProcessor. This processor demonstrates the use of the PreviousFields parameter to take action based on user fields populated before the current file input but on the same form.

member.name: T:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.IFileProcessor
member.summary:
The IFileProcessor interface defines classes which are used to process an individual file coming from a form stream.
The interface defines methods to start the file processing (with a file name and content type), write data, and end the upload process.
IFileProcessor implementations are used to write uploaded data to persistant storage such as the file system or a database.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.IFileProcessor.StartNewFile(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Starts a new file.
member.param: The content type of the file.
A dictionary of items pulled from the header of the field.
member.returns: An optional object used to identify the item in the storage container.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.IFileProcessor.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes to the output file.
member.param: Offset in the buffer to write from.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.IFileProcessor.EndFile
member.summary: Ends current file processing.

member.summary: Returns the name of the file that is currently being processed. Null if there is no file.
member.returns: The file name.

member.summary: Gets the identifier in the container.

member.name: T:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.FormStream
member.summary:
Implements a stream which can be used to parse an RFC1867 (HTTP upload) compliant HTTP request.
The stream writes it's output to an IFileProcessor implementation on a file by file basis.

member.summary: Fires the error event.

member.summary: Fires the FileCompleted event.

member.summary: Fires the FileCompletedError event.
member.param: An optional identifier passed from the processor and used to identify the item in the storage container.

member.name: T:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadModule
member.summary: Http handler which can process very large file uploads by passing the request stream to a FormStream instance for persistance by an IFileProcessor implementation.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadModule.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadModule.Init(System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.summary: Initialises the module.

member.summary: Disposes of the module.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadModule.Context_AuthenticateRequest(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
Called when a new request commences (but after authentication). Preloads the request header and initialises the form stream.
We do this after authentication so that the file processor will have access to the security context if it is required.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadModule.fs_FileStarted(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Updates the currently processed file when the file stream indicates it has started processing a new file.

member.summary: Adds a file to the error collection of the status when the form stream indicates that a file has completed in error.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadModule.fs_FileCompleted(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a file to the completed collection of the status when the form stream indicates that a file has completed.

member.summary: Gets the Http worker request.
member.returns: Worker request.

member.name: T:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadWorkerRequest
member.summary: Implements an internal HTTPWorkerRequest which is replaced in the request and allows the upload module to spoof the preloaded content. This method is also acceptable for IIS 7 integrated mode.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadWorkerRequest.#ctor(System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The content minus the uploaded files.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadWorkerRequest.ReadEntityBody(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads request data from the client (when not preloaded).
member.param: The byte array to read data into.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The number of bytes read.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadWorkerRequest.GetTotalEntityBodyLength
member.summary: Gets the length of the entire HTTP request body.
member.returns: An integer containing the length of the entire HTTP request body.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadWorkerRequest.GetPreloadedEntityBody(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the portion of the HTTP request body that has currently been read by using the specified buffer data and byte offset.
member.param: The byte offset at which to begin reading.
member.returns: The portion of the HTTP request body that has been read.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadWorkerRequest.GetPreloadedEntityBody
member.summary: Returns the portion of the HTTP request body that has already been read.
member.returns: The portion of the HTTP request body that has been read.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadWorkerRequest.GetPreloadedEntityBodyLength
member.summary: Gets the length of the portion of the HTTP request body that has currently been read.
member.returns: An integer containing the length of the currently read HTTP request body.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadWorkerRequest.ReadEntityBody(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads request data from the client (when not preloaded) by using the specified buffer to read from, byte offset, and maximum bytes.
member.param: The byte array to read data into.
The byte offset at which to begin reading.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The number of bytes read.

member.summary: Returns the standard HTTP request header that corresponds to the specified index.

member.returns: The HTTP request header.

member.name: M:darrenjohnstone.net.FileUpload.UploadWorkerRequest.IsEntireEntityBodyIsPreloaded
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether all request data is available and no further reads from the client are required.
member.returns: true if all request data is available; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Terminates the connection with the client.
